Package org.rapidcontext.app.web

Class WebDavRequest

java.lang.Object
org.rapidcontext.app.web.WebDavRequest
All Implemented Interfaces:
HttpUtil
public class WebDavRequest extends Object implements HttpUtil
A WebDAV request handler. This class is used to help analyzing a PROPFIND request and generate the proper response.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Per Cederberg

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface org.rapidcontext.util.HttpUtil

    HttpUtil.HEADER, HttpUtil.Helper, HttpUtil.METHOD, HttpUtil.STATUS

  • Constructor Details

    • WebDavRequest

      public WebDavRequest(Request request) throws Exception
      Creates a new WebDAV request.
      Parameters:
      request - the HTTP request to read
      Throws:
      Exception - if the WebDAV request XML couldn't be parsed

  • Method Details

    • depth

      public int depth()
      Returns the requested depth of properties.
      Returns:
      the requested depth of properties, or -1 for infinity

    • timeout

      public String timeout()
      Returns the requested lock timeout value.
      Returns:
      the requested lock timeout value, or null if not specified

    • lockInfo

      public Dict lockInfo()
      Returns information about the requested lock (if applicable).
      Returns:
      the requested lock, or null if the request wasn't a valid lock request

    • addResource

      public void addResource(String href, Date created, Date modified, long size)
      Adds a resource to the result with the specified dates and size.
      Parameters:
      href - the root-relative resource link
      created - the resource creation date
      modified - the resource modification date
      size - the resource size (in bytes)

    • sendLockResponse

      public void sendLockResponse(Dict lockInfo, int timeout)
      Sends a lock response with the specified information.
      Parameters:
      lockInfo - the lock information
      timeout - the lock timeout

    • sendMultiResponse

      public void sendMultiResponse()
      Sends a multi-status response with the response fragments as the request response.
      See Also:
      • addResource(String, Date, Date, long)

    • sendErrorFiniteDepth

      public void sendErrorFiniteDepth()
      Sends a finite depth error as the request response.
